section.title: Fresh Installation
section.p:
For a new, fresh installation we need to download a 7z-/Zip-archive of Schoorbs. To make Schoorbs accessible from the web we need to extract the archive into a directory, which the webserver can access. In the most common cases on Linux, you use /var/www.
$ cd /var/www
$ 7zr x schoorbs.7z or $ unzip schoorbs.zip
After we have extract all the files, we need to copy config.inc.php-dist to config.inc.php we will later set all configuration options.
$ cd schoorbs
$ cp config.inc.php-dist config.inc.php
Now all files need for Schoorbs are in the right place and should be accessbile by the wevserver, for the storage of the data of the bookings and available rooms, we need to setup the database.

section.title: Database setup
section.p: If you're making a new installation of Schoorbs, you have to generate the database environment for it. There are some differences between MySQL and PostgreSQL which are explained in the following paragraphs.

section.title: MySQL
section.p:
First, we connect to the database as root, if you have set a password for root, you need to the option --password at the end of this command.
$ mysql --user=root mysql
If you do not already have a database were we could create the tables for schoorbs, then we need to create one, we name it schoorbs in this example.
mysql> CREATE DATABASE schoorbs;
For access to the database we need a valid combination of username and password, in the best (most secure) case, it just has access to the database in which we store the data for Schoorbs. If already one exists, skip this step.
mysql> GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON schoorbs.* TO 'schoorbs'@'%' IDENTIFIED BY 'test'; generates a user schoorbs with password test and full access to the database schoorbs.
In the next step we need to create the tables. With the given file tables.my.sql you create all the needed tables with the prefix 'schoorbs_', if you want another prefix, you have to change it at each command. For legacy/ backward-compability-cases, it's a tables-legacy.my.sql available, where all commands start with 'mrbs_'. The following command should execute the sql-commands from the file in the file:
$ mysql schoorbs < --user=schoorbs --password=test tables.my.sql

section.title: Databaseconfiguration in Schoorbs
section.p: After we now should have a working database structure, we need to tell Schoorbs how to access the database. All configuration about database in done in Schoorbs at the head of the config.inc.php. At first we have to inform Schoorbs which database driver it should use (variable $dbsys), for PostgreSQL we have at the moment only one option, the 'psql'-driver. But if you use MySQL, you can choose, if you want to use the 'mysql'- oder the 'mysqli'-driver. You can use the 'mysql'-driver for PHP 4 and PHP 5, but the 'mysqli'-driver is limited to PHP 5. It does not really make a difference which driver you use, 'mysql' may be more stable and 'mysqli' may have a better performance.

With $db_host we tell Schoorbs where the database server is running, in most cases 'localhost' is the best choice. In $db_database we set the database where the tables are stored, the table prefix is defined in $db_tbl_prefix. $db_login and $db_password are the places to store the authentication details. If you want to use peristent (pooled) connection, you have to set $db_nopersist to true.

section.title: Calendar settings
section.p: In Schoorbs there are two ways to setup the calendar, the first one is the clock-based. It lets you define when the days starts and when it ends. In this timespan, it is always possible to book the room/resource but only in fixed timespan, e.g. all 45 minutes. The other way is the period-based. Here you define timespans by giving them a name rather than setting up a fixed time unit, these names could be times too, but they all will be handled as strings. You choose your favourite system by setting $enable_periods either to true or to false.

section.title: Setting up a clock-based calendar
section.p: A clock-based calendar may not be as simple as a period-based calendar, but it could save you the work of naming each time unit. At first we have to define in $resolution how long a timespan is, the length is defined in seconds, so a time unit of half an hour would be $resolution = 1800;. With $morningstarts you set the hour when a day starts, with $morningstarts_minutes you do it with the minutes. $eveningends and $eveningends_minutes do the same for the end of the day. For people who care about the beginning of the week, could set this with $weekstarts either to sunday(set to 0) or monday(set to 1). In some countries it is common to have the da in front of the month, in others there's the month in front of the day. Schoorbs takes care of this difference with $dateformat, with a value of '0' the month is in front, with 1 it's the day. Another difference is the hour format, mostly english contries have 1-12pm/am, the others have 0-23/24, for the first case you have to set $twentyfourhour_format to 0, for the other case to 1.

section.title: Miscellaneous settings
section.p:
Excluding the site identification settings there are a lot more simple settings. In the configuration file, they are all metioned by small comment each.
These settings control:

ul.li: the maximum number of repeat entries which can be created at once (a safety feature)
the number of search results to return per page
the way area/rooms are selected (html list or a drop-down select box)
the way entries are displayed in monthly view (start/end slot, brief description or both)
the way weeks are displayed in the bottom of the page (as week numbers (ie. 42) instead of 'first day of the week' (13 Oct))
display of times on right and left side in day and week view
display of horizontal stripes on the day view
the default starting view (month, week or day)
the default room to start with

section.title: Site identification information
section.p: With the variables $mrbs_admin and $mrbs_admin_email you define who your administration contact is and under which mail he is contactable. This information is shown on the help-page. If you want to change the branding in the left top, you have to edit $mrbs_company. Please take special care of this variable, because the content of it is send directly to the user, which makes it possible to insert (X)HTML-Code in it. When Schoorbs is running behind a proxy, it sometimes may happen that the URLs are broken, to override the used URL-base you just need to set $url_base to a valid adress.

section.title: E-Mail support
section.p: At the moment mail support is not considered as stable since we had to switch to a other mail-protocol-wrapper library through legal issues. For experimental/hopeful users, please refer to our copy of the old MRBS documentation (the mail-wrapper is still backwards compatible).
